rise to more questions that need to be answered. That is one way in which
science makes progress.
SCIENTIFIC REVOLUTIONS
Another type of scientific development is more radical—knowledge is not
simply  extended,  but,  instead,  one  scientific  framework  is  replaced  (or
largely replaced) by another. What changes is not just particular claims, but
large-scale ways of doing science. In biology, the germ theory of disease and
the theory of evolu
